Enter a string: UTF-8 Encoded Bytes: 73 226 128 153 109 32 103 111 105 110 103 32 116 111 32 102 111 99 117 115 32 111 110 32 116 104 101 32 99 104 97 114 97 99 116 101 114 32 115 101 116 32 97 110 100 32 119 104 97 116 226 128 153 115 32 105 110 118 111 108 118 101 100 32 105 110 32 119 111 114 107 105 110 103 32 119 105 116 104 32 115 116 114 105 110 103 115 32 97 110 100 32 102 105 108 101 115 32 111 102 32 85 110 105 99 111 100 101 32 116 101 120 116 46 32 72 111 119 101 118 101 114 44 32 105 110 32 116 104 105 115 32 97 114 116 105 99 108 101 32 73 226 128 153 109 32 110 111 116 32 103 111 105 110 103 32 116 111 32 116 97 108 107 32 97 98 111 117 116 32 102 111 110 116 115 44 32 116 101 120 116 32 108 97 121 111 117 116 47 115 104 97 112 105 110 103 47 114 101 110 100 101 114 105 110 103 44 32 111 114 32 108 111 99 97 108 105 122 97 116 105 111 110 32 105 110 32 100 101 116 97 105 108 226 128 148 116 104 111 115 101 32 97 114 101 32 115 101 112 97 114 97 116 101 32 105 115 115 117 101 115 44 32 98 101 121 111 110 100 32 109 121 32 115 99 111 112 101 32 40 97 110 100 32 107 110 111 119 108 101 100 103 101 41 32 104 101 114 101 46 
I’m going to focus on the character set and what’s involved in working with strings and files of Unicode text. However, in this article I’m not going to talk about fonts, text layout/shaping/rendering, or localization in detail—those are separate issues, beyond my scope (and knowledge) here.
Enter new vocab size: 256: 105 110
257: 32 116
258: 256 103
passed
